body.transcript:
Hello, thank you for calling NoteWorthy, the leading music school! My name is Arthur Bell. May I have your name, please?

Hi Arthur, this is Martha Evans, and I'm really upset about my recent bill.

I'm sorry to hear that, Martha. Let me help you get to the bottom of this. Could you please tell me your account number?

Sure, the account number is one two three four five.

Thank you, Martha. I see your account here. Could you let me know the specific issue with the billing?

The bill shows an extra charge of fifty dollars that I don't recognize. Why is this there?

I apologize for any inconvenience caused. Let me check that for you. I see there was a charge for an additional class on the tenth of last month. Did you not attend this class?

No, I didn't. There must be a mistake.

I understand your frustration. Let me verify this for you. Could you confirm the last four digits of your phone number for security purposes?

Yes, it’s two three four five.

Thank you. I've verified that was indeed an error. I'll make sure the charge is removed and you receive a credit on your next billing cycle. I apologize again for the confusion.

Thank you for resolving this, Arthur. I appreciate it.

You're welcome, Martha. Thank you for bringing it to our attention. Have a great day!

analysis.body: In this conversation, Arthur Bell from NoteWorthy discusses billing with Martha Evans. The agent provides assistance and information about Music School.

Hello, thank you for calling NoteWorthy, the leading music school! My name is Arthur Bell. May I have your name, please?

Hi Arthur, this is Martha Evans, and I'm really upset about my recent bill.

I'm sorry to hear that, Martha. Let me help you get to the bottom of this. Could you please tell me your account number?

Sure, the account number is one two three four five.

Thank you, Martha. I see your account here. Could you let me know the specific issue with the billing?

The bill shows an extra charge of fifty dollars that I don't recognize. Why is this there?

I apologize for any inconvenience caused. Let me check that for you. I see there was a charge for an additional class on the tenth of last month. Did you not attend this class?

No, I didn't. There must be a mistake.

I understand your frustration. Let me verify this for you. Could you confirm the last four digits of your phone number for security purposes?

Yes, it’s two three four five.

Thank you. I've verified that was indeed an error. I'll make sure the charge is removed and you receive a credit on your next billing cycle. I apologize again for the confusion.

Thank you for resolving this, Arthur. I appreciate it.

You're welcome, Martha. Thank you for bringing it to our attention. Have a great day!
